title: Ligatures dropping out
content:
Hi all,

I generated a .ttf file of a font that was created in FontLab 5.0. When I tried it out in Illustrator CS3, I found out that while my ligatures are working, for some reasons some parts of it drops out (image attached).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203093308im_/http:/typophile.com/files/a_3425.jpg)

I really have no clue what's causing this, so I was wondering if someone could point out what might be going on and how to fix it. Also, this only happens with the ligatures starting with lowercase a â€” so I wonder if there's a possibility that there's some problems with the glyph that I probably overlooked?

Thank you in advance.

Cheers,  
Christa
author: christa

comments.content: Try to reverse the contour direction on your a contours.
Looks like two separate glyphs. Set path direction to TT and merge the contours before generating the font?
Did both suggestions, problem solved now! Thanks, guys.
